articles.title: Razor wire 13ft border fence to stop migrants dumped in EU under consideration by Lithuania - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Lithuanian parliament will hold debate amid accusations 'Europe's last dictator' is trying to use migrants to force EU to drop sanctions
articles.content:
The Lithuanian parliament will on Tuesday debate whether to build a high metal fence topped with razor wire on its border with Belarus to stop migrants who have been crossing in record numbers.

articles.title: European Space Agency's Solar Orbiter completes its second flyby of Venus - Daily Mail
articles.description: Solar Orbiter is on its way to study the polar regions of the sun in a bid to better understand its 11-year cycle and made its close approach at 05:42 BST, according to the European Space Agency.
articles.content:
The European Space Agency's Solar Orbiter spacecraft has made its second flyby of Venus, just 33 hours before the BepiColombo craft makes its close approach.
